title: Crew Travel Authority
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Crew Travel Authority This Authority is for international airline crew who don't have an Australian or New Zealand passport, or a valid Australian visa who travel to and from Australia as they work. Overview About this authority Eligibility Step by step When you have this authority Overview About this authority Eligibility Step by step When you have this authority Overview Stay International airline crew members and safety inspectors - up to 30 days as holder of a special purpose visa Airline positioning crew members - up to 5 days as holder of a special purpose visa Cost Free Processing times There are no processing times available for this visa. With this travel authority, you can... travel to Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa stay in Australia for up to 30 days if you are an airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa stay in Australia for up to 5 days if you are a positioning crew member as holder of a special purpose visa The CTA registration is valid for the life of the passport based on the passport expiry date See all conditions Check your eligibility You must: be registered as crew by your air carrier be travelling on a commercial or chartered passenger flight, freight or cargo flight as an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector About this authority About this authority Private flight operators With this travel authority you can How long you can stay New Zealand passport holders Stay longer Cost Obligations Travel Visa label Include family About this authority Under the Special Purpose visa framework, a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) is an electronic immigration record. Commercial airlines register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities to aid uplift. The registration is valid for the life of the passport. Commercial airlines can use the Carrier Portal to check that their international aircrew can legally enter Australia. International airline flights include: commercial passenger flights or chartered passenger flights or freight or cargo flights Crew members with Australian or New Zealand passports do not need Crew Travel Authorities. If you are a New Zealand citizen further information regarding your entry requirements, entitlements and pathway to permanent residence and citizenship can be found at the New Zealand citizens webpage. Private flight operators People operating private flights can't register for, or use a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) to enter Australia. The flight must be a commercial or chartered flight carrying passengers or cargo. To see what other visas you might be eligible for use the Visa Finder With this travel authority you can visit Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector who is employed by a foreign government arrive as a passenger (as an airline positioning crew member) on a commercial aircraft to move an international aircraft from Australia arrive in Australia as an aircraft safety inspector, if you hold a valid government identity document showing you are employed by a foreign government, or if you hold an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate How long you can stay If you are an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector, you can stay in Australia for up to 30 days. If you are an airline positioning crew member, you can stay in Australia for up to 5 days. New Zealand passport holders If you are a New Zealand citizen crew member who arrives in Australia and do not hold another visa (such as a permanent residence visa) and you wish to remain in Australia longer than the above periods, you should not enter Australia via SmartGate. Instead, you should approach a border clearance officer and make an application to be granted a Special Category visa (subclass 444) by: completing an incoming passenger card and presenting your New Zealand passport The SCV will allow you to live, visit, work and study in Australia. When you leave Australia, your SCV will end. Next time you enter Australia, you will apply for a new SCV. Entering Australia on a Special Purpose visa as a crew member rather than an SCV may impact your status as a resident for social security purposes. If you apply for the SCV after you arrive in Australia, you will need to apply online and attend an appointment. For further information see New Zealand citizens Stay longer You can't stay in Australia as the holder of a Special Purpose visa longer than allowed. You must apply for another type of visa if you want to stay longer. Cost Free Obligations You must obey Australian laws. You cannot use a Crew Travel Authority to: travel as a passenger to Australia, unless you are an airline positioning crew member or work on more than one domestic leg in Australia, this domestic leg must be part of an international arrival or departure flight Travel You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want when working as an airline aircrew member or as an airline safety inspector, while the Crew Travel Authority is valid. The time you spend outside Australia does not extend the Crew Travel Authority. The Crew Travel Authority registration is valid for the life of your passport and is based on your passport expiry date. Visa label We will digitally link your Crew Travel Authority to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport. Include family You can't include family on this travel authority. Eligibility Be an airline crew member, positioning crew or aircraft safety inspector on an eligible international airline flight Details You must be travelling on an international airline flight that is a: commercial passenger flight, or chartered passenger flight, or freight or cargo flight You must also be: an airline crew member who: is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew travels to Australia as part of your job as aircrew will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger or an airline positioning crew member who: is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew travels to Australia as an air passenger as part of your job will leave Australia as aircrew or an aircraft safety inspector who: is employed by a foreign government to inspect the safety procedures of international air carriers or the safety of aircraft travels to Australia by air as part of your job will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide. Step by step Step 1 Before you apply Air carriers usually register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities. If you plan to renew your passport, you need to do so before your carrier registers you for a Crew Travel Authority (CTA). Show steps Check your passport Your CTA is linked to your passport number. You need to use the same passport to travel to Australia. Step 2 Gather your documents You will need: a valid passport or other travel document a valid Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate See the documents you will need to show when you arrive in Australia. You are obliged to prove your identity and provide true information with your application Show steps Aircraft safety inspectors We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors a Special Purpose visa for 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold: a valid passport, and a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government, or an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate You must also be included in a list of crew members given to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft. See how Air crew documents We will grant Airline crew members a Special Purpose visa for 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold: a valid passport a valid Airline Identity Card They must also be included in a list of crew members provided to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft. Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier. See how Air positioning crew documents Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted a Special Purpose visa for 5 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold a valid passport. They must also have a letter from their employer that: certifies that they are an aircrew member sets out the purpose of their travel details the arrangements for them to leave Australia See how Step 3 Register for the Authority online Carriers can register crew members through Carrier Portal . They can also check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities. Carriers that do not have access to the Carrier Portal can register crew for Crew Travel Authorities by emailing appinfringements@abf.gov.au Step 4 After you register The airline carrier will be notified immediately if your registration is successful. See what you can and must do after you are registered. Show steps Stay lawful You must obey all Australian laws while in Australia. Tell us if things change Things you need to let us know about after you have applied include: changes to your phone number, address or passport you want to withdraw your application See how to tell us if your situation changes For any other issues, email appwebsite@abf.gov.au When you have this authority Going to Australia In Australia Leaving Australia Going to Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents You must have a valid: Crew Travel Authority to enter Australia passport or other travel document Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate At the border After registering for a Crew Travel Authority, you must also show other documents when you arrive in Australia. Airline crew members We will grant Airline crew members a Special Purpose visa for 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they: hold a valid passport or other travel document hold a valid Airline Identity Card and are included on the crew list provided to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft. Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier. Airline positioning crew Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted a Special Purpose visa for 5 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they hold a valid passport or other travel document. They must also have a letter from their employer that: certifies that they are an airline crew member sets out the purpose of their travel details the arrangements for them to leave Australia Aircraft safety inspectors We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors a Special Purpose visa for 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they: hold a valid passport or other travel document hold a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government as an airline safety inspector an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate and are included in a list of crew members given to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft. In Australia Staying longer You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this travel authority. You must apply for another visa if you want to stay longer. Proving you have a valid Crew Travel Authority Airline carriers and Australian border officials can use the Advance Passenger Processing system to check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities. Leaving Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia. At the Border Leaving the airport faster We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use SmartGate After you leave International Movement Record To prove you have been to Australia, request your international movement records
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================

# Crew Travel Authority

Crew Travel Authority

This Authority is for international airline crew who don't have an Australian or New Zealand passport, or a valid Australian visa who travel to and from Australia as they work.

This Authority is for international airline crew who don't have an Australian or New Zealand passport, or a valid Australian visa who travel to and from Australia as they work.

This Authority is for international airline crew who don't have an Australian or New Zealand passport, or a valid Australian visa who travel to and from Australia as they work.
- Overview
Overview
- About this authority
About this authority
- Eligibility
Eligibility
- Step by step
Step by step
- When you have this authority
When you have this authority
Overview
About this authority
Eligibility
Step by step
When you have this authority
Overview

#### Stay

Stay
- International airline crew members and safety inspectors - up to 30 days as holder of a special purpose visa
International airline crew members and safety inspectors - up to 30 days as holder of a special purpose visa
- Airline positioning crew members - up to 5 days as holder of a special purpose visa
Airline positioning crew members - up to 5 days as holder of a special purpose visa

#### Cost

Cost

Free

Free

#### Processing times

Processing times

There are no processing times available for this visa.

There are no processing times available for this visa.

#### With this travel authority, you can...

With this travel authority, you can...
- travel to Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa
travel to Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa
- stay in Australia for up to 30 days if you are an airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa
stay in Australia for up to 30 days if you are an airline crew member or safety inspector as holder of a special purpose visa
- stay in Australia for up to 5 days if you are a positioning crew member as holder of a special purpose visa
stay in Australia for up to 5 days if you are a positioning crew member as holder of a special purpose visa
- The CTA registration is valid for the life of the passport based on the passport expiry date
The CTA registration is valid for the life of the passport based on the passport expiry date

See all conditions

See all conditions

Check your eligibility

Check your eligibility

#### You must:

You must:
- be registered as crew by your air carrier
be registered as crew by your air carrier
- be travelling on a commercial or chartered passenger flight, freight or cargo flight as an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector
be travelling on a commercial or chartered passenger flight, freight or cargo flight as an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector
About this authority
About this authority
Private flight operators
With this travel authority you can
How long you can stay
New Zealand passport holders
Stay longer
Cost
Obligations
Travel
Visa label
Include family

## About this authority

About this authority

Under the Special Purpose visa framework, a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) is an electronic immigration record. Commercial airlines register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities to aid uplift. The registration is valid for the life of the passport. Commercial airlines can use theCarrier Portalto check that their international aircrew can legally enter Australia.

Under the Special Purpose visa framework, a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) is an electronic immigration record. Commercial airlines register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities to aid uplift. The registration is valid for the life of the passport. Commercial airlines can use the
Carrier Portal
to check that their international aircrew can legally enter Australia.

International airline flights include:

International airline flights include:
- commercial passenger flights or
commercial passenger flights or
- chartered passenger flights or
chartered passenger flights or
- freight or cargo flights
freight or cargo flights

Crew members with Australian or New Zealand passports do not need Crew Travel Authorities.

Crew members with Australian or New Zealand passports do not need Crew Travel Authorities.

If you are a New Zealand citizen further information regarding your entry requirements, entitlements and pathway to permanent residence and citizenship can be found at theNew Zealand citizenswebpage.

If you are a New Zealand citizen further information regarding your entry requirements, entitlements and pathway to permanent residence and citizenship can be found at the
New Zealand citizens
webpage.

## Private flight operators

Private flight operators

People operating private flights can't register for, or use a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) to enter Australia. The flight must be a commercial or chartered flight carrying passengers or cargo.

People operating private flights can't register for, or use a Crew Travel Authority (subclass 942) to enter Australia. The flight must be a commercial or chartered flight carrying passengers or cargo.

To see what other visas you might be eligible for use theVisa Finder.

To see what other visas you might be eligible for use the
Visa Finder
.

## With this travel authority you can

With this travel authority you can
- visit Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector who is employed by a foreign government
visit Australia as part of your work as an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector who is employed by a foreign government
- arrive as a passenger (as an airline positioning crew member) on a commercial aircraft to move an international aircraft from Australia
arrive as a passenger (as an airline positioning crew member) on a commercial aircraft to move an international aircraft from Australia
- arrive in Australia as an aircraft safety inspector, if you hold a valid government identity document showing you are employed by a foreign government, or if you hold an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate
arrive in Australia as an aircraft safety inspector, if you hold a valid government identity document showing you are employed by a foreign government, or if you hold an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate

## How long you can stay

How long you can stay

If you are an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector, you can stay in Australia for up to 30 days.

If you are an international airline crew member or aircraft safety inspector, you can stay in Australia for up to 30 days.

If you are an airline positioning crew member, you can stay in Australia for up to 5 days.

If you are an airline positioning crew member, you can stay in Australia for up to 5 days.

## New Zealand passport holders

New Zealand passport holders

If you are a New Zealand citizen crew member who arrives in Australia and do not hold another visa (such as a permanent residence visa) and you wish to remain in Australia longer than the above periods, you should not enter Australia via SmartGate. Instead, you should approach a border clearance officer and make an application to be granted aSpecial Category visa (subclass 444)by:

If you are a New Zealand citizen crew member who arrives in Australia and do not hold another visa (such as a permanent residence visa) and you wish to remain in Australia longer than the above periods, you should not enter Australia via SmartGate. Instead, you should approach a border clearance officer and make an application to be granted a
Special Category visa (subclass 444)
by:
- completing an incoming passenger card and
completing an incoming passenger card and
- presenting your New Zealand passport
presenting your New Zealand passport

TheSCVwill allow you to live, visit, work and study in Australia.

The
SCV
will allow you to live, visit, work and study in Australia.

When you leave Australia, your SCV will end. Next time you enter Australia, you will apply for a new SCV.

When you leave Australia, your SCV will end. Next time you enter Australia, you will apply for a new SCV.

Entering Australia on aSpecial Purpose visaas a crew member rather than an SCV may impact your status as a resident for social security purposes.

Entering Australia on a
Special Purpose visa
as a crew member rather than an SCV may impact your status as a resident for social security purposes.

If you apply for the SCV after you arrive in Australia, you will need to apply online and attend an appointment. For further information seeNew Zealand citizens

If you apply for the SCV after you arrive in Australia, you will need to apply online and attend an appointment. For further information see
New Zealand citizens

## Stay longer

Stay longer

You can't stay in Australia as the holder of aSpecial Purpose visalonger than allowed. You must apply for another type of visa if you want to stay longer.

You can't stay in Australia as the holder of a
Special Purpose visa
longer than allowed. You must apply for another type of visa if you want to stay longer.

## Cost

Cost

Free

Free

## Obligations

Obligations

You must obey Australian laws. You cannot use a Crew Travel Authority to:

You must obey Australian laws. You cannot use a Crew Travel Authority to:
- travel as a passenger to Australia, unless you are an airline positioning crew member or
travel as a passenger to Australia, unless you are an airline positioning crew member or
- work on more than one domestic leg in Australia, this domestic leg must be part of an international arrival or departure flight
work on more than one domestic leg in Australia, this domestic leg must be part of an international arrival or departure flight

## Travel

Travel

You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want when working as an airline aircrew member or as an airline safety inspector, while the Crew Travel Authority is valid.

You can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want when working as an airline aircrew member or as an airline safety inspector, while the Crew Travel Authority is valid.

The time you spend outside Australia does not extend the Crew Travel Authority.

The time you spend outside Australia does not extend the Crew Travel Authority.

The Crew Travel Authority registration is valid for the life of your passport and is based on your passport expiry date.

The Crew Travel Authority registration is valid for the life of your passport and is based on your passport expiry date.

## Visa label

Visa label

We will digitally link your Crew Travel Authority to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.

We will digitally link your Crew Travel Authority to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.

## Include family

Include family

You can't include family on this travel authority.

You can't include family on this travel authority.
Eligibility

## Be an airline crew member, positioning crew or aircraft safety inspector on an eligible international airline flight

Be an airline crew member, positioning crew or aircraft safety inspector on an eligible international airline flight
Details

You must be travelling on an international airline flight that is a:

You must be travelling on an international airline flight that is a:
- commercial passenger flight, or
commercial passenger flight, or
- chartered passenger flight, or
chartered passenger flight, or
- freight or cargo flight
freight or cargo flight

You must also be:

You must also be:
- anairline crew memberwho:is employed by an international air carrier as aircrewtravels to Australia as part of your job as aircrewwill leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passengeror
an
airline crew member
who:
- is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
- travels to Australia as part of your job as aircrew
travels to Australia as part of your job as aircrew
- will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger
will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger
or
- anairline positioning crew memberwho:is employed by an international air carrier as aircrewtravels to Australia as an air passenger as part of your jobwill leave Australia as aircrewor
an
airline positioning crew member
who:
- is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
is employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
- travels to Australia as an air passenger as part of your job
travels to Australia as an air passenger as part of your job
- will leave Australia as aircrew
will leave Australia as aircrew
or
- anaircraft safety inspectorwho:is employed by a foreign government to inspect the safety procedures of international air carriers or the safety of aircrafttravels to Australia by air as part of your jobwill leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger
an
aircraft safety inspector
who:
- is employed by a foreign government to inspect the safety procedures of international air carriers or the safety of aircraft
is employed by a foreign government to inspect the safety procedures of international air carriers or the safety of aircraft
- travels to Australia by air as part of your job
travels to Australia by air as part of your job
- will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger
will leave Australia by air as part of your job or as a passenger

Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in ourstep by stepguide.

Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our
step by step
guide.
Step by step

Step 1

Step 1
Before you apply

Air carriers usually register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities. If you plan to renew your passport, you need to do so before your carrier registers you for a Crew Travel Authority (CTA).

Air carriers usually register crew members for Crew Travel Authorities. If you plan to renew your passport, you need to do so before your carrier registers you for a Crew Travel Authority (CTA).
Show
                    steps

#### Check your passport

Check your passport

Your CTA is linked to your passport number. You need to use the same passport to travel to Australia.

Your CTA is linked to your passport number. You need to use the same passport to travel to Australia.

Step 2

Step 2
Gather your documents

You will need:

You will need:
- a valid passport or other travel document
a valid passport or other travel document
- a valid Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate
a valid Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate

See the documents you will need to show when you arrive in Australia.

See the documents you will need to show when you arrive in Australia.

You are obliged toprove your identity and provide true information with your application.

You are obliged to
prove your identity and provide true information with your application
.
Show
                    steps

#### Aircraft safety inspectors

Aircraft safety inspectors

We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors aSpecial Purpose visafor 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold:

We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors a
Special Purpose visa
for 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold:
- a valid passport, and
a valid passport, and
- a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government, or
a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government, or
- an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate
an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate

You must also be included in a list of crew members given to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.

You must also be included in a list of crew members given to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.
See how

#### Air crew documents

Air crew documents

We will grant Airline crew members aSpecial Purpose visafor 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold:

We will grant Airline crew members a
Special Purpose visa
for 30 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold:
- a valid passport
a valid passport
- a valid Airline Identity Card
a valid Airline Identity Card

They must also be included in a list of crew members provided to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.

They must also be included in a list of crew members provided to us by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.

Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier.

Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier.
See how

#### Air positioning crew documents

Air positioning crew documents

Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted aSpecial Purpose visafor 5 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold a valid passport.

Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted a
Special Purpose visa
for 5 days, beginning when they disembark from the aircraft, provided they hold a valid passport.

They must also have a letter from their employer that:

They must also have a letter from their employer that:
- certifies that they are an aircrew member
certifies that they are an aircrew member
- sets out the purpose of their travel
sets out the purpose of their travel
- details the arrangements for them to leave Australia
details the arrangements for them to leave Australia
See how

Step 3

Step 3
Register for the Authority online

Carriers can register crew members throughCarrier Portal. They can also check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities.

Carriers can register crew members through
Carrier Portal
. They can also check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities.

Carriers that do not have access to the Carrier Portal can register crew for Crew Travel Authorities by emailingappinfringements@abf.gov.au

Carriers that do not have access to the Carrier Portal can register crew for Crew Travel Authorities by emailing
appinfringements@abf.gov.au

Step 4

Step 4
After you register

The airline carrier will be notified immediately if your registration is successful. See what you can and must do after you are registered.

The airline carrier will be notified immediately if your registration is successful. See what you can and must do after you are registered.
Show
                    steps

#### Stay lawful

Stay lawful

You must obey all Australian laws while in Australia.

You must obey all Australian laws while in Australia.

#### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change

Things you need to let us know about after you have applied include:

Things you need to let us know about after you have applied include:
- changes to your phone number, address or passport
changes to your phone number, address or passport
- you want to withdraw your application
you want to withdraw your application

Seehow to tell us if your situation changes.

See
how to tell us if your situation changes
.

For any other issues, emailappwebsite@abf.gov.au

For any other issues, email
appwebsite@abf.gov.au
When you have this authority
Going to Australia
In Australia
Leaving Australia

## Going to Australia

Going to Australia

### Before you leave

Before you leave

#### Check your travel documents

Check your travel documents

You must have a valid:

You must have a valid:
- Crew Travel Authority to enter Australia
Crew Travel Authority to enter Australia
- passport or other travel document
passport or other travel document
- Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate
Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate

### At the border

At the border

After registering for a Crew Travel Authority, you must also show other documents when you arrive in Australia.

After registering for a Crew Travel Authority, you must also show other documents when you arrive in Australia.

#### Airline crew members

Airline crew members

We will grant Airline crew members aSpecial Purpose visafor 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they:

We will grant Airline crew members a
Special Purpose visa
for 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they:
- hold a valid passport or other travel document
hold a valid passport or other travel document
- hold a valid Airline Identity Card and
hold a valid Airline Identity Card and
- are included on the crew list provided to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.
are included on the crew list provided to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.

Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier.

Crew members on freight flights should also be listed on the General Declaration Form signed on behalf of the air carrier.

#### Airline positioning crew

Airline positioning crew

Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted aSpecial Purpose visafor 5 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they hold a valid passport or other travel document.

Airline positioning crew members are automatically granted a
Special Purpose visa
for 5 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they hold a valid passport or other travel document.

They must also have a letter from their employer that:

They must also have a letter from their employer that:
- certifies that they are an airline crew member
certifies that they are an airline crew member
- sets out the purpose of their travel
sets out the purpose of their travel
- details the arrangements for them to leave Australia
details the arrangements for them to leave Australia

#### Aircraft safety inspectors

Aircraft safety inspectors

We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors aSpecial Purpose visafor 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they:

We will grant Aircraft safety inspectors a
Special Purpose visa
for 30 days, beginning from their arrival in Australia, provided they:
- hold a valid passport or other travel document
hold a valid passport or other travel document
- hold a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government as an airline safety inspector
hold a valid government identity document showing that they are employed by a foreign government as an airline safety inspector
- an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate and
an International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) Safety Inspector Certificate and
- are included in a list of crew members given to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.
are included in a list of crew members given to the Australian Border Force by or for the carrier that operates the aircraft.

## In Australia

In Australia

### Staying longer

Staying longer

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this travel authority. You must apply for another visa if you want to stay longer.

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this travel authority. You must apply for another visa if you want to stay longer.

### Proving you have a valid Crew Travel Authority

Proving you have a valid Crew Travel Authority

Airline carriers and Australian border officials can use the Advance Passenger Processing system to check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities.

Airline carriers and Australian border officials can use the Advance Passenger Processing system to check whether crew members hold valid Crew Travel Authorities.

## Leaving Australia

Leaving Australia

### Before you leave

Before you leave

#### Check your travel documents

Check your travel documents

You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia.

You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia.

### At the Border

At the Border

#### Leaving the airport faster

Leaving the airport faster

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you useSmartGate.

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use
SmartGate
.

### After you leave

After you leave

#### International Movement Record

International Movement Record

To prove you have been to Australia, request yourinternational movement records.

To prove you have been to Australia, request your
international movement records
.
